newsitem.title: USA: HFS to acquire Value Rent-A-Car for $175 mln.
newsitem.headline: HFS to acquire Value Rent-A-Car for $175 mln.

text.p: HFS Inc said Monday it reached an agreement in principle to acquire Value Rent-A-Car from Mitsubishi Motor Sales of America for $175 million in cash.

Value, a unit of Japan's Mitsubishi Motors Corp, mostly serves leisure customers from 45 corporate-owned rental car sites, primarily in Florida. Value's fleet totals about 22,000 cars. During 1996, Value reported revenues of about $180 million. Closing is expected in the second quarter and is subject to customary conditions, including anti-trust clearance, execution of a definitive pact and board approvals.

HFS said it plans to expand Value through franchising additional locations. "We expect to offer Value franchises to existing Avis licensees, to (HFS unit) Avis Rent a Car, which is planned to become an independent public company during the third quarter of 1997, and to other rental car operators," said Stephen Holmes, HFS Vice Chairman. "We expect Value to be marginally accretive to earnings initially, but to become a more significant contributor in 1998."
HFS and Mitsubishi also intend to enter into a vehicle supply agreement and related marketing agreements in connection with Value's continuing fleet purchases from Mitsubishi.
Mitsubishi Motor Sales of America Inc markets a full line of motor vehicles.
HFS is a global consumer services company.
